title: Terminator's Linda Hamilton doesn't go easy on Dark Fate stunt doubles
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

You don’t want to mess with Linda Hamilton.

28 years after she blazed onto screens as Sarah Connor, the action star is back for Terminator: Dark Fate – and, according to Arnold Schwarzenegger, she’s fitter than the first film.

We have to agree!

The actor, 63, has teamed back up with Arnie, 72, for the story that picks up right where 1991’s Judgement Day finished off. The woman is on a mission and there is another saviour she needs to protect at all costs.

Advertisement

With the epic fight scenes, gun battles and high-octane sequences turned up to 11, Dark Fate has been hailed a Terminator masterpiece.

Speaking of her ‘affection’ for Arnold as they reunite on screen, the action stalwart revealed to Metro.co.uk that despite the difference in age since she last took on Sarah, the script hardly went easy on her.

And she loved it.

Boss (Picture: Paramount Pictures)

‘I always want to do as much as possible on any film. I don’t want to give up one second of film to someone else,’ she told us exclusively ahead of the release this week.

‘Even though the stunt women might be fitter and more able to take those falls, I love Sarah Connor and … I was constantly on the stunt women, “hold that weapon tighter, I want you to have tendonitis in your right elbow like I do!”

Back in the OG Terminator (Picture: Rex Features)

‘This fierceness that I have that, apparently, is unmatchable.’

She continued: ‘[The] Stuntwomen were fantastic, but I was constantly, “bend your elbow with that weapon, get your stance down, hold that tighter”, because that’s the kind of work that I put in and don’t want anyone else to mess it up.’

Sarah Connor is still a force to be reckoned with (Picture: Paramount Pictures)

Yep, we’re sufficiently intimidated.

Arnold echoed his co-star’s sentiments, as he mused on her ‘no quit’ spirit.

‘She’s really into it,’ he told us.

‘One time I watched her submerged in a HUMV in the water and it was up to here [motions to neck], so you could only breathe like this and she’s in that vehicle for hours and they kept saying “does she want to come out for a bit, to relax?” [Linda would reply] “No no no, I’m in character right now, let’s finish this”.

Advertisement

‘She gets so into it and it’s such a pleasure to watch that when someone is really into it, she’s in the character and no work is too much.’

Linda worked her butt off, literally, to get into peak health to run around shooting guns for two hours, ditching carbs for a year and enlisting the help of Serena Williams’ trainer.

And Arnold was impressed.

‘I have to say I was blown away by Linda’s performance because not only from an acting point of view, the physicality of it. When you talk about her age, it’s not the same when you’re 60-years-old and you jump around [as] when you’re 20 or 30; it’s much more difficult.

‘But she trained like crazy and put the hours and reps into it and did the weapons training and was as good as she was in Terminator 2 – if not better.’

That’s some praise.

Terminator: Dark Fate is in UK cinemas Wednesday 23 October.
